item.title: Happy World Emoji Day: an analysis of rOpenSci's Slack emojis
item.description: HAPPY world emoji day! üåç üêî üìÜ In honor of this momentous occasion, I have decided to analyze the emojis used on rOpenSci‚Äôs Slack. library("dplyr") ‚äïIf you‚Äôd like to follow along, go fetch yourself a Slack token. token <- "MY_SLACK_API_TOKEN" ## stick your token here We will first use Slack‚Äôs reactions.list method. ‚äïNotice here I am pulling the items from the response and then from each item I am interested in the message reactions.

item.title: runconf17, an analysis of emoji use
item.description: I had such a delightful time at rOpenSci‚Äôs unconference last week. ‚äï21 üì¶ were produced! Not only was it extremely productive, but in between the crazy productivity was some epic community building. Stefanie kicked the conference off with ice breakers, where we explored topics ranging from #rcatladies & #rdogfellas ‚äïfor the record, I‚Äôm an #rchickenlady, IT‚ÄôS HAPPENING to impostor syndrome. It was an excellent way to get conversations starting! work Karthik and I worked on two packages:

item.title: The prevalence of drunk podcasts
item.description: For today‚Äôs rendition of I am curious about everything, in Hilary Parker & Roger Peng‚Äôs Not So Standard Deviations Episode 32, Roger suggested the prevalence of drunk podcasting has dramatically increased - so I thought I‚Äôd dig into it üößüë∑. I pulled the iTunes API for the term drunk in podcasts & plotted the results over time. I also finally found an excuse to use emoGG. library('dplyr') library('ggplot2') req <- httr::GET(url = "https://itunes.

item.title: CatterPlot thank you note
item.description: Lara Harmon has put in countless hours to build and uplift the ASA Student community. We are SO grateful. We know she loves cats, as evidenced by ‚äï On the off-chance you have not felt judged by a cat today, my cat can help you out. pic.twitter.com/sApgbyYztD ‚Äî Lara Harmon (@Amstat_Lara) December 27, 2016 and You'll notice that we have yet to be in a city where I can convince our design team cats would be 100% on-theme.
